  • public class BinarySearchTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends BinaryTree<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(T value)
      add - starts recursion from the root node
      boolean containsNode(T value)
      containsNode - method to traverse the tree to check if the node with T value exists
      boolean containsNodeRecursive(Node<T> current, T value)
      containsNodeRecursive - Recursive helper method that traverses the tree
      Node recursiveAdd(Node<T> current, T value)
      recursiveAdd - recursive helper to insert new node If the new node's value is lower than the current node's, we go to the left child If the new node's value is greater than the current node's we go the right child when the current node is null, we've reached a leaf node and we can insert the new node in that position
      Node<T> search(T value)
      search - Brings in a value of node, and returns the node with the desired value
      Node<T> searchNodeRecursive(Node<T> current, T value)
      searchNodeRecursive - Recursive helper method that traverses the tree

      • recursiveAdd

        public Node recursiveAdd(Node<T> current,
                         T value)
        recursiveAdd - recursive helper to insert new node If the new node's value is lower than the current node's, we go to the left child If the new node's value is greater than the current node's we go the right child when the current node is null, we've reached a leaf node and we can insert the new node in that position
